sections.text:
RCW 62A.2-514

When documents deliverable on acceptance; when on payment.

Unless otherwise agreed documents against which a draft is drawn are to be delivered to the drawee on acceptance of the draft if it is payable more than three days after presentment; otherwise, only on payment.

Unless otherwise agreed documents against which a draft is drawn are to be delivered to the drawee on acceptance of the draft if it is payable more than three days after presentment; otherwise, only on payment.

[1965 ex.s. c 157 s 2-514. Cf. former RCW 81.32.411; 1961 c 14 s 81.32.411; prior: 1915 c 159 s 41; RRS s 3687; formerly RCW 81.32.500.]

RCW 62A.2-514

When documents deliverable on acceptance; when on payment.

Unless otherwise agreed documents against which a draft is drawn are to be delivered to the drawee on acceptance of the draft if it is payable more than three days after presentment; otherwise, only on payment.

Unless otherwise agreed documents against which a draft is drawn are to be delivered to the drawee on acceptance of the draft if it is payable more than three days after presentment; otherwise, only on payment.

[1965 ex.s. c 157 ยง 2-514. Cf. former RCW 81.32.411; 1961 c 14 ยง 81.32.411; prior: 1915 c 159 ยง 41; RRS ยง 3687; formerly RCW 81.32.500.]

RCW 62A.2-515

Preserving evidence of goods in dispute.

In furtherance of the adjustment of any claim or dispute(a) either party on reasonable notification to the other and for the purpose of ascertaining the facts and preserving evidence has the right to inspect, test and sample the goods including such of them as may be in the possession or control of the other; and(b) the parties may agree to a third party inspection or survey to determine the conformity or condition of the goods and may agree that the findings shall be binding upon them in any subsequent litigation or adjustment.

In furtherance of the adjustment of any claim or dispute

(a) either party on reasonable notification to the other and for the purpose of ascertaining the facts and preserving evidence has the right to inspect, test and sample the goods including such of them as may be in the possession or control of the other; and

(b) the parties may agree to a third party inspection or survey to determine the conformity or condition of the goods and may agree that the findings shall be binding upon them in any subsequent litigation or adjustment.

[1965 ex.s. c 157 s 2-515.]
